Description: Body and handle sherd (mended from several fragments) of Chian pottery patterned chalice with part of foot; white slip; interior glazed black; exterior: lower wall reserved; in handle zone double saw-edged metope pattern between groups of six long vertical lines; black on top and outside of handle, reserved on underside; on lower body, two narrow bands; top of splaying conical foot glazed. underside reserved
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the decoration, see Reading 26.2.63 and British Museum 1886,0401.1042.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 232, pl. 6, no. 69)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0348) (phase 2)
